word_letter_focus.title: Grammar: Adjectives
word_letter_focus.directions: Read the sentences. Highlight the word or words indicated before each sentence.

sentence.text: Choose the adjectives: My grandparents live in an {wh}old{/wh} house in the country.
Choose the adjectives: Grandma is a {wh}great{/wh} cook who makes {wh}delicious{/wh} meals.
Choose the adjectives: We pick {wh}fresh{/wh} blueberries in the {wh}nearby{/wh} woods when we visit.
Choose the adjectives: Grandma bakes them into a {wh}blueberry{/wh} pie in her {wh}big{/wh} oven.
Choose the adjectives: Ed likes to make a {wh}green{/wh} salad.
Choose the adjectives: He buys {wh}many{/wh} vegetables at the {wh}local{/wh} market.
Choose the adjectives: Then he mixes the vegetables together in a {wh}giant wooden{/wh} bowl.
Choose the adjectives: He adds his {wh}favorite{/wh} cheese and mixes that in too.
Choose the predicate adjectives: Our favorite restaurant is {wh}friendly{/wh}.
Choose the predicate adjectives: The owner seems {wh}nice{/wh}.
Choose the predicate adjectives: The waiters are {wh}attentive{/wh} to your needs.
Choose the predicate adjectives: The head chef is {wh}skillful{/wh} and {wh}creative{/wh}.
Choose the predicate adjectives: Breakfast is {wh}important{/wh} to everyone.
Choose the predicate adjectives: Oatmeal is {wh}nourishing{/wh} and {wh}tasty{/wh}.
Choose the predicate adjectives: Eggs are {wh}rich{/wh} in protein.
Choose the predicate adjectives: {wh}Multigrain{/wh} pancakes are {wh}delicious{/wh} and {wh}nutritious{/wh}.
Choose the proper adjectives: We love {wh}Mexican{/wh} food at our house.
Choose the proper adjectives: My sister makes {wh}Tex-Mex{/wh} dishes like tacos and enchiladas.
Choose the proper adjectives: My brother puts {wh}Tabasco{/wh} sauce on nearly everything he eats.
Choose the proper adjectives: We’re planning to celebrate the {wh}Mexican{/wh} holiday Cinco de Mayo.
Choose the proper adjectives: Jill and Jayvon ate at a {wh}Chinese{/wh} restaurant.
Choose the proper adjectives: Jayvon ordered {wh}General Tso’s{/wh} chicken.
Choose the proper adjectives: Jill likes mild {wh}Cantonese{/wh} dishes.
Choose the proper adjectives: Their mother wore a {wh}Japanese{/wh} kimono.
Choose any adjectives whose order can be switched: Mark ate a {wh}pink delicious{/wh} cookie.
Choose any adjectives whose order can be switched: I enjoy eating {wh}oatmeal big{/wh} cookies.
Choose any adjectives whose order can be switched: My sister eats only fresh oatmeal cookies.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: I have a big black dog that is very friendly.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: My dog loves to chew on {wh}old gross{/wh} socks.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: One time he ate my {wh}green new{/wh} socks.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: Sam has a {wh}large scary{/wh} snake as a pet.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: He has to feed the big brown snake {wh}gray small{/wh} mice.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: His cat eats {wh}brown normal{/wh} cat food.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: I ride on a strong, {wh}black, young{/wh} horse.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: I enjoy brushing the horse’s {wh}silky black{/wh} tail.
Choose the adjectives that can be switched: The horse is two years old and has a long coarse mane.
